title: Shapes as Product Differentiation: Neural Network Embedding in the Analysis of Markets for Fonts
abstract: arXiv:2107.02739v2 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: Many differentiated products have key attributes that are unstructured and thus high-dimensional (e.g., design, text). Instead of treating unstructured attributes as unobservables in economic models, quantifying them can be important to answer interesting economic questions. To propose an analytical framework for these types of products, this paper considers one of the simplest design products-fonts-and investigates merger and product differentiation using an original dataset from the world's largest online marketplace for fonts. We quantify font shapes by constructing embeddings from a deep convolutional neural network. Each embedding maps a font's shape onto a low-dimensional vector. In the resulting product space, designers are assumed to engage in Hotelling-type spatial competition. From the image embeddings, we construct two alternative measures that capture the degree of design differentiation. We then study the causal effects

translated_title: 形状作为产品差异化：神经网络嵌入在字体市场分析中的应用
translated_abstract: 许多差异化产品具有关键属性，这些属性是非结构化的，因此是高维的（例如设计，文本）。本文提出了一个分析框架，考虑了一个最简单的设计产品 - 字体，研究了合并和产品差异化，使用了来自全球最大在线字体市场的原始数据集。我们通过从深度卷积神经网络构建嵌入来量化字体形状。每个嵌入将字体的形状映射到低维向量上。在得到的产品空间中，设计师被假设进行Hotelling类型的空间竞争。从图像嵌入中，我们构建了两种捕捉设计差异程度的替代度量。然后我们研究了因果效应。
tldr: 本文提出了一种通过神经网络嵌入字体形状进行产品差异化分析的方法，研究了设计产品中的市场合并和差异化竞争。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a method for analyzing product differentiation by embedding font shapes using neural networks, and explores market mergers and differentiation competition in design products.
